Response Forest Plot Table

Response Forest Plot Table

t_forest_rsp(rsp, col_by, group_data = NULL, total = "ALL",
  na.omit.group = TRUE)

Arguments

col_by

factor with reference and comparison group information, the first level indicates the reference group
group_data

data frame with one column per grouping variable
rep

Tumor Response data

Details

Logistic model is used for odds ratio calculation

Examples


library(random.cdisc.data)
ASL <- radam("ASL")
ARS <- radam("ARS", ADSL = ASL)
ASL$PSUEDO <- ASL$SEX

ARS_f <- ARS %>% filter(PARAMCD == "OVRSPI")
ANL <- merge(ASL %>% select(USUBJID, STUDYID, SEX, RACE, PSUEDO, ARM), ARS_f)
head(ANL)
#>   USUBJID STUDYID SEX                             RACE PSUEDO   ARM PARAMCD
#> 1    id-1 STUDY A   F        BLACK OR AFRICAN AMERICAN      F ARM A  OVRSPI
#> 2   id-10 STUDY A   M                            ASIAN      M ARM A  OVRSPI
#> 3  id-100 STUDY A   F AMERICAN INDIAN OR ALASKA NATIVE      F ARM B  OVRSPI
#> 4   id-11 STUDY A   F                            WHITE      F ARM A  OVRSPI
#> 5   id-12 STUDY A   F                            ASIAN      F ARM A  OVRSPI
#> 6   id-13 STUDY A   F AMERICAN INDIAN OR ALASKA NATIVE      F ARM B  OVRSPI
#>    PARAM AVALC AVAL
#> 1 OVRSPI    PR    2
#> 2 OVRSPI    SD    3
#> 3 OVRSPI    PD    5
#> 4 OVRSPI    PR    2
#> 5 OVRSPI    CR    1
#> 6 OVRSPI    PR    2

tbl <- t_forest_rsp(
  rsp = ANL$AVALC %in% c("CR", "PR"),
  col_by = factor(ANL$ARM),
  group_data = as.data.frame(lapply(ANL[, c("SEX", "RACE")], as.factor))
)

Viewer(tbl)
